settingsPane.description: Experimental: Enable below AUTOPLUG mode to let cortexbrain control CPU cores dynamically. When screen on, dynamic mode will be utilized which means second core turns on only when required. When screen off, single core mode will be utilized which means second core will be turned off forcefully. Keep this mode on for power save.
settingsPane.name: CPU Core Control

checkbox.description: Enable/Disable the CPU Core AUTOPLUG Mode! (Dynamic by Cortex)
checkbox.name: CPU AutoPlug
checkbox.label: CPU AutoPlug

settingsPane.description: You can change max and min frequencies of your device here. 800 MHz is minimum limit of max frequency as below this frequency your device will suffer from high performance degradation. 800 MHz is also maximum limit of min frequency as above this frequency your device will not cool down. (Default: Max 1400 MHz, Min 200 MHz)
settingsPane.name: CPU Frequency control

seekBar.description: This slider sets maximum frequency of your device.
seekBar.name: Max CPU Frequency

seekBar.description: This slider sets minimum frequency of your device.
seekBar.name: Min CPU Frequency

settingsPane.description: You can change CPU governor of your device here. Hyper governor is highly tweaked Ondemand governor which will give you best performance with little impact on battery juice while AbyssPlug is tweaked hotplug governor which is more precise scaling down CPU performance when not in need. NeoX is combined ondemand and pegausq governor. (Default: Hyper)
settingsPane.name: CPU Governor control

spinner.description: This will set the active CPU governor.
spinner.name: Default CPU Governor

spinner.description: This will set the standby and sleep CPU governor. (Dynamic by cortex)
spinner.name: Sleep CPU Governor

settingsPane.description: You can change CPU IO scheduler of your device here. For best stability use ROW. (Default: ROW)
settingsPane.name: CPU IO Scheduler control

spinner.description: This will set the default IO scheduler for internal, system, data and external sdcard.
spinner.name: Default IO Scheduler

spinner.description: This will set the standby and sleep IO scheduler for internal, system, data and external sdcard. (Dynamic by cortex)
spinner.name: Sleep IO Scheduler

settingsPane.description: Here, you can set all the settings for power saving! Between screen off and deep sleep states, there are some idle modes supported by cpuidle driver. They are IDLE aka Normal Idle, LPA aka Deep Idle and AFTR aka ARM Off Top Running. Race to idle by CPU is implemented for power management. Recommended for power saving is to enable AFTR and LPA. For best stability use Idle + LPA. (Default: AFTR + LPA)
settingsPane.name: CPU Idle and Power Settings

spinner.description: Sets the CPU Idle Mode.
spinner.name: CPU Idle Mode

spinner.description: Sets the CPU Idle (Sleep) Mode. (Dynamic by cortex)
spinner.name: CPU Idle (Sleep) Mode

seekBar.description: This is for CPU BUS-FREQ UP-FREQ-Scaling based on CPU load. It sets the load threshold on which BUS frequency will rise. (Default: 25%)
seekBar.name: busfreq_up_threshold

settingsPane.description: You can check what frequency the GPU is at right now.
settingsPane.name: Current GPU Frequency

button.description: This displays current GPU frequency.
button.name: GPU Frequency Check
button.label: GPU Frequency Check

settingsPane.description: You can monitor what frequency the GPU is running at.
settingsPane.name: GPU Frequency Monitor

button.description: Tap here to start monitoring.
button.name: Start GPU Frequency Monitor
button.label: Start GPU Frequency Monitor

button.description: Tap here to stop monitoring.
button.name: Stop GPU Frequency Monitor
button.label: Stop GPU Frequency Monitor

settingsPane.description: GPU frequency/voltage/steps/utilization settings. Default frequencies are 134, 160, 200, 267, 267. Default voltages are 950, 950, 1000, 1050, 1050.
settingsPane.name: GPU Control

seekBar.description: Here, you can change GPU utilization timeout calculation. Closer to 100ms (0.1sec) = faster GPU response in steps jump on load, more battery drain. CM10 default: 1000 (1sec)
seekBar.name: GPU Utilization Timeout

spinner.description: Changes the first (lowest) GPU frequency step.
spinner.name: GPU Frequency Step 1

spinner.description: Changes the second GPU frequency step.
spinner.name: GPU Frequency Step 2

spinner.description: Changes the third GPU frequency step.
spinner.name: GPU Frequency Step 3

spinner.description: Changes the fourth GPU frequency step. WARNING! 400 MHz needs more than 1000 mV.
spinner.name: GPU Frequency Step 4

spinner.description: Changes the fifth GPU frequency step. WARNING! 400 MHz needs more than 1000 mV.
spinner.name: GPU Frequency Step 5

settingsPane.description: GPU Voltage Levels: The defaults are 950, 950, 1000, 1050, 1050. WARNING! Voltage above 1300 mV can be dangerous! Do not blame me if GPU chip gets burned.
settingsPane.name: GPU Voltage Levels

seekBar.description: GPU voltage for the first step
seekBar.name: GPU Voltage Level 1

seekBar.description: GPU voltage for the second step
seekBar.name: GPU Voltage Level 2

seekBar.description: GPU voltage for the third step
seekBar.name: GPU Voltage Level 3

seekBar.description: GPU voltage for the fourth step
seekBar.name: GPU Voltage Level 4

seekBar.description: GPU voltage for the fifth step
seekBar.name: GPU Voltage Level 5

settingsPane.description: GPU load thresholds to change between frequency steps.
settingsPane.name: GPU Thresholds

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump up from first to second step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 1-UP

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump down from second to first step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 2-DOWN

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump up from second to third step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 2-UP

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump down from third to second step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 3-DOWN

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump up from third to fourth step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 3-UP

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump down from fourth to third step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 4-DOWN

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump up from fourth to fifth step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 4-UP

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump down from fifth to fourth step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 5-DOWN

settingsPane.description: Here, you can tune memory and OOM (Out of Memory killer - low memory management) settings managed by the kernel.
settingsPane.name: Memory Tuning

spinner.description: Here, you can set the OOM level by kernel LowMemKiller function. More aggressive = more free RAM, more killed apps.
spinner.name: OOM Level Tuning - screen on

spinner.description: Here, you can set the OOM level by kernel LowMemKiller function. More aggressive = more free RAM, more killed apps.
spinner.name: OOM Level Tuning - screen off

seekBar.description: Dirty background memory buffer. Higher value = more memory will be used for write buffer for background operations. Buffer is released when RAM needs to be freed (Default: 10%)
seekBar.name: Dirty Background ratio

seekBar.description: Dirty real time memory buffer. Higher value = more memory will be used for write buffer for real time operations. Buffer is released when RAM needs to be freed (Default: 15%)
seekBar.name: Dirty ratio

button.description: Clean RAM cache. This will release all cached and buffered RAM
button.name: CLEAN RAM CACHE
button.label: Clean RAM Cache

spinner.description: ZRAM Module settings. Here, you can enable/disable ZRAM or add more compressed RAM for your system. (Default: 100 MB)
spinner.name: ZRAM Settings

spinner.description: If you have enabled swap, higher number = the more the system will swap. Keeping swappiness '0' means swapping occurs only when your device runs out of memory, increasing swappiness will result more battery consumption. Please note SWAP is effective only if ZRAM is not off.(Default: 0)
spinner.name: swappiness

button.description: ZRAM state check
button.name: ZRAM STATS
button.label: ZRAM Stats

checkbox.description: Enable/Disable 'Ultra KSM Control'. This will merge some memory but consumes more CPU and battery. This depends on Cortex Brain, so you will have to stop and start the service or reboot your phone.
checkbox.name: Ultra KSM Control
checkbox.label: Ultra KSM Control

button.description: Ultra KSM state check
button.name: Ultra KSM STATS
button.label: Ultra KSM Stats

settingsPane.description: Here, you can set the current intensity (measured in milliamperes) you want your phone to take in while charging. Allowed mA, by default, is between 450 mA and 650 mA! Remember: higher currents *could potentially* reduce battery life over time. So, the higher the currents = more chances your battery life will decay during a period of time. The lower the currents = less chances your battery will decay during that period of time. Set currents higher WHEN AND IF you need your phone to charge faster. Turn currents down to 450 mA when you are charging overnight. Charging at 1000 mA will take 2 hours and 30 minutes. Charging at 450 mA will take up to 6 hours.
settingsPane.name: Battery Charge

button.description: If you think that the fuel gauge chip is behaving weird, use this button to reset it. Afterwards, give it a few hours to stabilize. It may still show you funny values until it settles, but once it settled, the battery percentage should be fine.
button.name: Reset Fuel-Gauge Chip
button.label: Reset Fuel-Gauge Chip

settingsPane.description: Here, you can fine tune touch screen specific settings. More settings may be added later.
settingsPane.name: Touch Screen Tuning

seekBar.description: This tunes touch panel sensitivity. Lower values = smoother, but your screen may start running ahead of your finger - ghost touch. (CM default: 50, NX default: 30)
seekBar.name: Touch Sensitivity

spinner.description: Select preferred hand for S Pen usage. (Default: Right-Handed)
spinner.name: Preferred Hand for S Pen

seekBar.description: Vibration (haptic feedback) force level. To test vibration force, simply press the physical menu button. (Default: 75)
seekBar.name: Vibration force

checkbox.description: LCD Power Reduce for backlight. If you like brighter screen in cost of battery drain, then turn it off. (Default: On)
checkbox.name: LCD POWER
checkbox.label: LCD Power Reduce

settingsPane.description: mobile Digital Natural Image engine control. Samsungs hardware image post-processor controls virtually any image manipulation. mDNIe settings of the device must be selected from here, not Advanced Device Settings.
settingsPane.name: Global controls

spinner.description: Sets the scenario for mDNIe. (Default: UI)
spinner.name: mDNIe scenario

spinner.description: Sets the mode for mDNIe. (Default: Dynamic)
spinner.name: mDNIe mode

spinner.description: Enable/Disable Inverted colors. (Default: Normal)
spinner.name: mDNIe Negative mode

spinner.description: Enable/Disable Outdoor Mode. (Default: Off)
spinner.name: mDNIe Outdoor mode

checkbox.description: Register intercept acts like a hook and will enable catching scenario settings and modifying them through delta controls. PLEASE NOTE if a scenario does not have a setting (register) in its base sequence, then it cannot be modified by the hook. The register hook, while used on Samsung's profiles, is not capable to alter effects which are not integrated in that screen profile's value sequence, the 'Movie' profile for example lacks some effects present in the 'Dynamic' profile. The same is valid when having different scenarios, the 'Camera' scenario will use different effects in its base than the 'UI' scenario.
checkbox.name: Register intercept
checkbox.label: Enable register hook

checkbox.description: Enabling the master sequence will disable and ignore mDNIe profiles and scenarios, even below controls will be disabled. Master sequence is under test and improvement.
checkbox.name: Master sequence
checkbox.label: Enable master sequence

checkbox.description: mDNIe sharpness tweaks. Requires hook intercept and reboot to be effective.
checkbox.name: mDNIe sharpness tweaks
checkbox.label: mDNIe Sharpness Tweaks

settingsPane.description: Changes white colour temperature
settingsPane.name: White colour temperature control

seekBar.description: If your screen has a tint to it, this is the first control you should try to fix as it alters temperature on all channels. Starting point is 6500K.
seekBar.name: Colour temperature

settingsPane.description: The SCR controls is divided in 8 channels, RGB, YCM, W and K. SCR controls are RGB modifiers on each of the controls altering the primary luminosities on that channel.
settingsPane.name: White colour balance

settingsPane.description: This script will manipulate many kernel settings, based on chosen NXTweaks profile + settings and screen state (ON/OFF). We call it 'CortexBrain'. To reset the kernel settings, after you disable a tweak, you must reboot!
settingsPane.name: CortexBrain Tweaks

spinner.description: Enable/Disable the 'background-process' from 'CortexBrain'. If you disable it, you will lose the function that sets different settings for screen state (ON/OFF).
spinner.name: CortexBrain-Background-Process

button.description: Click to see if the 'CortexBrain-Background-Process' is running or not.
button.name: Check Background-Process
button.label: Check Service

spinner.description: Here, you can control Android logger 'logcat'. If you set it to AUTO, then you will have logs only when screen is on. When screen is off, logger will be disabled to save battery. If you set it to DEBUG, it will be working no matter what! If set to DISABLED, logging will be off, no matter what. If USB or wall charger is connected and logger is set to AUTO, logging will be enabled so we can debug. Depends on CortexBrain-Background-Process to be enabled! (Dynamic by Cortex).
spinner.name: Android Logger control

checkbox.description: Enable/Disable the 'DATA turns off while screen is off' function. Depends on CortexBrain-Background-Process to be enabled! (Dynamic by Cortex)
checkbox.name: Auto-Data
checkbox.label: Force Auto-Data

seekBar.description: Here, you can set a delay before DATA is forced to OFF when screen is turned off. Works only if 'Auto-DATA' is enabled! (Dynamic by Cortex)
seekBar.name: DATA Turn Off Delay (in sec)

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable the Wifi turns off while screen is off function. (Dynamic by Cortex)
checkbox.name: Auto-Wifi
checkbox.label: Force Auto-Wifi

seekBar.description: Here you can set a delay before WIFI is forced to OFF when screen is turned off. (Dynamic by Cortex)
seekBar.name: WIFI Turn Off Delay (in sec)

checkbox.description: Enable/Disable 'ICMP only Firewall-Tweaks' (reboot required).
checkbox.name: Firewall-Tweaks
checkbox.label: Firewall-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable/Disable 'TCP-Tweaks' (reboot required).
checkbox.name: TCP-Tweaks
checkbox.label: TCP-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable/Disable 'TCP-RAM-Tweaks' (reboot required).
checkbox.name: TCP-RAM-Tweaks
checkbox.label: TCP-RAM-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable/Disable 'IPv6 Network' (Dynamic by Cortex).
checkbox.name: IPv6 Tweaks
checkbox.label: IPv6 Network

checkbox.description: Enable/Disable 'Memory-Tweaks' (reboot required).
checkbox.name: Memory-Tweaks
checkbox.label: Memory-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable/Disable 'Battery-Tweaks' (reboot required).
checkbox.name: Battery-Tweaks
checkbox.label: Battery-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable/Disable 'System-Tweaks' (reboot required).
checkbox.name: System-Tweaks
checkbox.label: System-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable/Disable 'Kernel-Tweaks' (reboot required).
checkbox.name: Kernel-Tweaks
checkbox.label: Kernel-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable/Disable 'I/O-Tweaks' (reboot required).
checkbox.name: I/O-Tweaks
checkbox.label: I/O-Tweaks

settingsPane.description: Here, you can activate some scripts which will automatically run in the background at a specified time.
settingsPane.name: cron

spinner.description: Main switch for Cron Tasker. If you set this to OFF, then all tasks listed below will have no effect!
spinner.name: CRON TASK MAIN SWITCH

button.description: Use this button to test if the 'Cron Task service' is ONLINE and supported! If main switch is ON and service is OFFLINE, then ROM BusyBox does not support Cron. Update BusyBox or ROM in order for this to work.
button.name: Test Cron Task Service
button.label: Test Cron Task Service

button.description: Use this button to RESET the scripts and jobs from kernel, to refresh the configuration. This will clear all your custom changes!
button.name: CRON RESET
button.label: Reset Cron

checkbox.description: Cron to clear RAM cache every hour, but only if CPU is IDLE and more than 50% of your memory is used! This will free RAM from unused buffers and cache.
checkbox.name: Clean RAM cache
checkbox.label: Clear RAM cache every hour

checkbox.description: Cron to DB Optimize every day at 3:00AM, only if CPU is IDLE!
checkbox.name: DB Optimization
checkbox.label: DB Optimization task every day at 3:00AM

checkbox.description: Cron to clear app-cache every day at 4:00AM, only if CPU is IDLE!
checkbox.name: Clean app-cache
checkbox.label: Disk Clean task every day at 4:00AM

checkbox.description: Cron to fix app-permissions every day at 4:40AM, only if CPU is IDLE! This can help to reduce errors, bugs, and applications FC.
checkbox.name: Fix app-permissions
checkbox.label: Fix permissions every day at 4:40AM

checkbox.description: Cron to ZipAlign apps every day at 4:50AM, only if CPU is IDLE! This can help reduce errors, bugs, applications FC and improve applications load speed. WARNING! Backup all apps before use! This process will remove apps that are BROKEN and not compressed or compiled correctly, so you may find some apps missing! USE IT AT YOUR OWN RISK and update the broken applications!
checkbox.name: ZipAlign Task
checkbox.label: ZipAlign Task every day at 4:50AM

button.description: Use this button to check if Cron Task Jobs are done as requested. This will show the log for all finished jobs.
button.name: Test Cron Task jobs
button.label: Test Cron Task Jobs

checkbox.description: Enable/Disable INIT.D scripts to run on boot. Many new ROMs are running the init.d scripts automatically. You can also force running the scripts, but if you run them and ROM runs them too, we have a problem: all scripts are running twice! To avoid conflicts, NXTweaks RUN-control is disabled by default. If you know that your ROM does NOT support init.d scripts running, then turn it ON here and reboot.
checkbox.name: INIT.D Scripts RUN control
checkbox.label: Enable INIT.D scripts RUN control

settingsPane.description: USB and SDcard settings and options.
settingsPane.name: USB - SDcard

spinner.description: Change USB connection mode. Either leave it as default or force it to UMS (USB Mass Storage mode) - you will see your SDcards as disks - or MTP (Media Transfer Protocol).
spinner.name: USB Mass Storage mode

checkbox.description: If checked, mass storage SDcards will be auto-mounted when USB is connected. Then, you can transfer files at high speeds from computer to device. (Default: Off)
checkbox.name: Auto Mount USB Drives
checkbox.label: Auto Mount USB Drives

button.description: Dual Mount SDcard and MMC via USB. Once the USB is disconnected, Dual Mount is disabled! This tweak is working automatically. Plug in the USB cable, turn off the screen, turn it on and you get working mounts. To scan your new MEDIA files, use some app to force Media Scan.
button.name: DUAL MOUNT
button.label: Dual Mount

settingsPane.description: Android Additional Logs
settingsPane.name: Logger

checkbox.description: Enable/Disable Android Additional Logs (requires reboot)
checkbox.name: Android Logger
checkbox.label: Android Logger

settingsPane.description: Quick Tweaks
settingsPane.name: Quick Tweaks

checkbox.description: Frandom is a Linux kernel random number generator which is 10-50 times faster than what you get from Linux built-in /dev/urandom. In case you face issue with wifi tethering you may try disabling this option and reboot. (Reboot required)
checkbox.name: FRANDOM
checkbox.label: FRANDOM

spinner.description: Maximum number of kilobytes to read-ahead for external SDcard file systems on this device. It is best to leave it to AUTO, then script will detect your external SDcard size and set the best value for it! The internal SDcard will get 1024kB as default and best for 16GB storage. Works only if 'I/O-Tweaks' is enabled! (Default: 128 kB)
spinner.name: kilobytes to read-ahead

button.description: Clean Wi-Fi DHCP IP Lease. Push the button to activate!
button.name: Clean Wi-Fi Lease
button.label: Clean Wi-Fi Lease

settingsPane.description: Here, you can find some settings/options for your apps.
settingsPane.name: Apps

button.description: Click here to start fixing. Here, you can run Fix Permissions. Please click one time only; scripts will finish in max 2~3min; no reboot is required.
button.name: FIX PERMISSIONS
button.label: Fix Permissions

button.description: Click here to start ZipAligning ONLY user apps. System may be unresponsive - it's OK, do not use the phone for ~2 minutes. WARNING! Backup all user applications before use! This process will remove applications that are BROKEN and not compressed or compiled correctly, so you may find some apps missing. USE IT AT YOUR OWN RISK and update the broken applications!.
button.name: ZIPALIGN
button.label: ZipAlign All Apps

button.description: Click here to start applications Database Optimization. Compacting, cleaning and indexing will take max 2 minutes.
button.name: DB OPTIMIZATION
button.label: Optimize DB

settingsPane.description: Here, you can find GPS and NTP settings.
settingsPane.name: GPS - NTP

spinner.description: GPS Time Zone for faster GPS lock! Choose your region!
spinner.name: GPS REGION

button.description: Click to see your current GPS Zone
button.name: GPS ZONE
button.label: GPS Zone Check

button.description: Update time via NTP server
button.name: UPDATE TIME
button.label: Update Time

settingsPane.description: Here, you can load kernel modules on boot that will allow some extra functions.
settingsPane.name: Kernel Modules

checkbox.description: Enable/Disable Samsung J4FS module load on boot. SMDK4210 tree had this module auto-load on boot but removed from exynos4 tree.
checkbox.name: J4FS Module
checkbox.label: J4FS Module

checkbox.description: Enable/Disable USB to Serial Modules. This will allow you to use USB to serial adapter to connect to ROUTERS and SWITCHES via console port. Requires reboot to become effective!
checkbox.name: USB to Serial
checkbox.label: Usb to Serial Modules

checkbox.description: Enable/Disable USB to Network Module This will allow you to use a limited number of USB to network card adapters. No support and no info can be provided if it will work. Requires reboot to become effective!
checkbox.name: USB to NetStick
checkbox.label: USB to Net Stick

checkbox.description: Enable/Disable CIFS Module. This will allow you to use apps that can mount internal storage and share over network. User can access data and system over network. No support can be provided. Requires reboot to become effective!
checkbox.name: CIFS Module
checkbox.label: CIFS Module

checkbox.description: Enable/Disable EDS Module (Encrypted Data Store). This lets you store your files in an encrypted container to prevent unauthorized access to sensitive information. If you want to use this, you need the EDS app from Play Store.
checkbox.name: EDS Module
checkbox.label: EDS Module

checkbox.description: Experimental: XBOX 360 wired controller support. This is experimental, please provide feedback on its functionality. Requires reboot to become effective!
checkbox.name: XPAD Module
checkbox.label: XPAD Module

button.description: This displays the currently loaded modules.
button.name: Show Loaded Modules
button.label: Show Loaded Modules

button.description: This button tries to force-load selected modules in the memory without requiring a reboot. This may not help, because most modules requires a reboot. This button is primarily for testing purposes.
button.name: Force-Load Modules
button.label: Force-Load Modules

settingsPane.description: Here, you can check what profile is being used right now.
settingsPane.name: Online Profile

button.description: This displays your currently used profile.
button.name: Profile Check
button.label: Profile Check

settingsPane.description: Here, you can choose from other profiles. If the phone freezes, let your device reboot itself within 2 min.
settingsPane.name: NXTweaks Profiles

button.description: This profile attempts to save battery whenever possible and it is recommended to use this profile whenever you are in need for battery for long time.
button.name: Extreme Battery Profile
button.label: Extreme Battery

button.description: This profile attempts to save battery by using power saving configuration parameters.
button.name: Battery Profile
button.label: Battery

button.description: This is the default profile, set to have balance between power saving and performance. This profile is recommended for users with not too many apps installed and moderate usage.
button.name: Default Profile
button.label: Default

button.description: This profile may give you very good performance but at the cost of some battery juice. Great profile for gamers with light games and for users having too many apps.
button.name: Performance Profile
button.label: Performance

button.description: This profile may give you great performance but is heavy on battery. Great profile for gamers with intensive graphics games like Arcane Legends, Blitz Brigade etc. Chipset might overheat while this profile is active.
button.name: Extreme Performance Profile
button.label: Extreme Performance

settingsPane.description: Here, you can backup/restore your profile after installing new kernel. When you restore your configuration, please wait until this app restarts with the new settings. Some settings will work only after reboot! Restore will take up to 30 seconds, just wait!
settingsPane.name: NXTweaks Settings Backup/Restore

button.description: Backup NXTweaks User Settings!
button.name: Settings Backup
button.label: Backup

button.description: Restore NXTweaks User Settings!
button.name: Settings Restore
button.label: Restore

settingsPane.description: Debug to SD-Card 'sdcard'
settingsPane.name: Bug-Report

button.description: Bug-Report for different kernel parameters like LMK, Schedulers, etc.
button.name: Kernel-Config-Debug
button.label: Kernel-Config-Debug

button.description: Bug-Report for apps using logcat
button.name: App-Debug
button.label: Apps-Debug

button.description: Bug-Report after kernel crash. Use this to report SODs (sleep of deaths) or random restarts; if you had to press the power key for 7 seconds to reset or after a random reboot. In case the phone lost power, there will be no log. Upload log to forum. We may try to get it resolved.
button.name: LAST-KERNEL-LOG
button.label: Last-Kernel-Log

settingsPane.description: Show Storage status. Here, you can see if you have errors in system, data, cache, efs or preload partitions. This will only SHOW if whether everything is OK or not, not fix errors!
settingsPane.name: Partitions Scan

button.description: Use this to check your system, data, cache, efs and preload partitions for errors. This will not FIX any errors, just check! To fix, backup your files with apps like Titanium Backup, then push the FIX DATA button. USE IT AT YOUR OWN RISK! Some data will be lost! You will need to restore broken apps + data. In case of boot loop, reinstall ROM. If you are still stuck on boot, perform a full wipe and install the ROM again! It's BETTER to have a clean partition than broken and unstable system, naturally.
button.name: Partition Status
button.label: Partition Status

button.description: Clean the media cache on your SDcard and start media rescan. Use at your own discretion. RESCAN MAY TAKE HOURS TO COMPLETE. Manual reboot is recommended.
button.name: Clean media cache
button.label: Clean media cache

button.description: DATA and CACHE file systems check and repair on boot. !WARNING! This is a VERY DANGEROUS operation! Before activating it MAKE A NANDROID BACKUP and backup your apps with Titanium Backup or similar applications! If you have a high ammount of damage in the DATA partition, after fix and repair, ROM may NOT BOOT anymore! In that case, reinstall ROM; if you still can't boot, you will have to format the DATA partition via recovery! USE IT AT YOUR OWN RISK! THIS FUNCTION IS NOT A TOY! YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED! It's a one time action, push the button to activate, push again to abort!
button.name: FIX File System on BOOT
button.label: Fix Data ON/OFF

button.description: Root check. Click to see if you have ROOT or not.
button.name: ROOT Check
button.label: Root Check
